results.title: Bugs Bunny's hare-raising tales
results.brief_description: Bugs Bunny is everybody’s favourite, no matter what your age. His whimsical humour and crazy adventures are timeless and this Warner Bros compilation of six much-loved classic cartoons is certain to provide some entertaining laughs. Watch out for the Errol Flynn cameo along with appearances by the Big Bad Wolf, the Three Little Pigs and Josemite Sam.

results.title: Bugs Bunny's 1001 rabbit tales
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures and Isadore Freleng
results.brief_description: Compilation of classic Merrie Melodies and Looney Tunes cartoons featuring Bugs and Daffy going on the road as two travelling salesmen for Rambling House Publishing Co. Sultan Yosemite Sam is their number one client, and Sam’s royal heir, the Crown Prince of Abadaba, demands constant storytelling, or tantrums ensue. Bugs is held captive reading aloud from the book he is selling. So Bugs retells several children’s classics in his own irreverent style. Voice characterisations by Mel Blanc.

results.title: Bugs and Daffy's carnival of the animals
results.brief_description: A combination of animation, live action scenes and orchestral music (conducted by Michael Tilson Thomas) provides an entertaining musical fantasy of composer Camille Saint-Saens’ classical composition “Carnival of the animals”. This is a salute to feathers, furs and fins most ably performed and co-hosted by everybody’s favourite cartoon twosome, Bugs Bunny and Daffy Duck. These wacky virtuoso display their wonderful stage talents by performing a piano duo (pianists Zita Carno, Kathryn Ando) and reciting some rather quirky poetry (courtesy of Ogden Nash) to illustrate the various carnival of animals, including lions, roosters, hens, kangaroos, and elephants. Contains an amalgamation of colourful and lively use of various animation styles. Voice characterisations by Mel Blanc.

results.title: Buffet Froid = Cold Cuts
results.creator_credit: WDR La Sept Cinema and Bertrand Blier
results.brief_description:
Alphonse Tram discovers his penknife planted in the belly of a moribund accountant lying in a subway corridor. He tries to engage in a conversation with the moribund who rebuffs him. Lost and angry, Alphonse goes back home, in the modern tower where he lives with his wife. She introduces him to their new neighbour, a police inspector. Later Alphonse’s wife is found murdered and her hapless murderer almost immediately confesses to Alphonse, but neither the husband, nor the police inspector seem to be shocked. The three sit down to enjoy a friendly drink when a man arrives and accuses Alphonse of the subway murder. ‘Buffet Froid’ is a wonderfully absurd black comedy that cunningly reverses the conventions of the crime thriller to comment on the alienating and dehumanizing effects of contemporary urban life.

Credits: Producer, Alain Sarde ; director, Bertrand Blier ; writer, Bertrand Blier ; photography, Jean Penzer ; music, Philippe Sarde, Johannes Brahms ; art direction, Theobald Meurisse.
Cast: Gerard Depardieu, Bernard Blier, Jean Carmet, Genevieve Page, Michel Serrault, Carole Bouquet, Jean Rougerie, Bernard Crombey, Denise Gence, Jean Benguigui, Liliane Rovere.

results.title: Buffaloes for ploughing
results.brief_description: The role of the water-buffalo in improving rice production in Malaya. Shows how a buffalo calf is trained as a farm animal. Its nostrils are pierced at six months and a ring inserted so that it can be led. At two years training is commenced, the buffalo learns how to pull, how to obey signals from his master and finally how to plough. Only patience and practice are needed to produce a thoroughly useful farm buffalo.

results.title: Buffalo: an ecological success story
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and John Walker
results.brief_description: Describes the physical traits of the North American buffalo and its natural habitat, its struggle for survival from the time vast herds ranged across the continent through the mass slaughters of the 1800’s, and the measures taken to save the buffalo from extinction. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Buffalo soldiers
results.creator_credit: Turner Pictures Worldwide, Gordon Wolf and Charles Haid
results.brief_description: A group of African-American cavalrymen ride into a desolate, racist and inhospitable frontier town. The town dishonours them, their Native American foes honour them, as Apache leader Victorio gives the soldiers a name of honour and strength, Buffalo Soldiers. The trooper’s daring hunt for Victorio (Harrison Lowe) frames this stirring tribute to the former slaves and other African- Americans of the 9th and 10th U.S Cavalry Regiments. Cast includes Danny Glover, Bob Gunton, Carl Lumbly and Glynn Turman.

results.title: Buffalo Bill and the Indians [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: De Laurentiis Entertainment Group and Robert Altman
results.brief_description: Robert Altman’s “Buffalo Bill and the Indians” sardonically explores the gap between western history and legend in show biz-obsessed America. Megalomaniac “Buffalo Bill” Cody assumes the legend created for him by writer Ned Buntline, aided and abetted by his producer and his publicist, perpetuating myths of white triumph over savage “Injuns” in his Wild West show, as audiences cheer him on and buy his merchandise. But when Sitting Bull joins the troupe with his interpreter, his request for authenticity threatens to throw a wrench into the proceedings. Regardless of how Bill may feel about the facts, he must bow to the preferences of the paying public. Cast includes: Paul Newman, Joel Grey, Kevin McCarthy, Harvey Keitel, Allan Nicholls, Geraldine Chaplin, Burt Lancaster, Frank Kaquitts.

results.title: Budjerri Dyillagami: Peggeralin
results.brief_description: A video artwork by Ngarigo artist Peter Waples-Crowe in collaboration with Glynn Urquhart.

constellations_other.name: Broadcasting marginal voices
constellations_other.description: The creation of Indigenous broadcasting in Central Australia from the late 1970s meant an array of diverse Black stories could be shared. Today, important stories told by those who physically and metaphorically live on the margins can be broadcast widely.

results.description: A video artwork by Ngarigo artist Peter Waples-Crowe in collaboration with Glynn Urquhart.
